oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Trinity United Methodist: fieldnotes
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Fieldnotes of Trinity United Methodist Church. Notes document the general layout of the building and provide basic information about the church.

Trinity United Methodist dates backs to 1880. In 1944, Hiwassee Lodge No. 31 constructed the current building. The red brick, Gothic building sits at the corner of 1st Street NE and Berry Street in Cleveland,Tennessee. At the time of fieldwork, the property was deemed eligible for the National Register.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee
